keyword: calories in a hamburger and bun
title: Calories in a Hamburger and Bun
meta_description: Discover calories in a hamburger and bun, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and tips for variations to fit your diet.
h1: Calories in a Hamburger and Bun
assumptions: Standard 4-oz (113 g) cooked beef patty, white sesame bun, basic toppings (lettuce, tomato, onion, 1 tsp ketchup); no cheese or mayo.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by patty size, bun type, toppings, cooking method, and brand. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard hamburger with bun provides about 250 kcal, with 15 g protein and 30 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add one slice of cheddar cheese
Use turkey patty instead of beef
Whole wheat bun and no ketchup

faqs.q: How many calories in a basic hamburger and bun?
faqs.a: About 250 kcal for a standard version with basic toppings.

faqs.q: What are the macros for a hamburger and bun?
faqs.a: Roughly 15 g protein, 10 g fat, 30 g carbs per hamburger.

faqs.q: Does the bun add a lot of calories to a hamburger?
faqs.a: Yes, the bun contributes about 120-150 kcal, mostly from carbs.

faqs.q: How does adding cheese change calories in a hamburger and bun?
faqs.a: One slice adds ~80 kcal, bringing the total to around 330 kcal.

faqs.q: Are there lower-calorie options for a hamburger and bun?
faqs.a: Opt for a smaller patty, whole grain bun, or veggie toppings to reduce to 200 kcal or less.
